name: rnadnavar-rna-editing-analysis
title: RNA-DNA Variant Analysis
description: RNA and DNA integrated analysis for somatic mutation detection with RNA editing support
content:
RNA-DNA Variant Analysis Pipeline

A bioinformatics best-practice analysis pipeline for RNA somatic mutation detection with integrated DNA analysis. Initially designed for cancer research, this pipeline uses multiple variant calling algorithms and applies a consensus approach for robust results.

Key Features

  • Multi-Algorithm Variant Calling: Utilizes Mutect2, Strelka2, and SAGE for comprehensive variant detection
  • RNA-Specific Processing: Specialized realignment step for RNA samples to handle higher background noise levels
  • RNA Editing Detection: Distinguishes true somatic mutations from RNA editing events
  • Consensus Approach: Combines results from multiple callers to produce high-confidence variant calls
  • GATK Best Practices: Follows established guidelines for data cleanup and quality control

Workflow Overview

  1. Data Preprocessing: Quality control and data cleanup following GATK best practices
  2. Variant Calling: Parallel execution of Mutect2, Strelka2, and SAGE variant callers
  3. RNA Realignment: Optional HISAT2 realignment at mutation coordinates to improve RNA-specific variant detection
  4. Post-Processing: VCF normalization, consensus calling, and filtering to produce final MAF file

Input Requirements

Provide a samplesheet (CSV or TSV format) containing sample information including RNA and/or DNA sequencing data paths. The pipeline supports both bulk RNA sequencing and whole genome/exome sequencing data.

Note: This pipeline addresses the unique challenges of detecting somatic mutations in RNA sequencing data while accounting for RNA editing events and the higher background noise typical of RNA samples.

Resources

Originally developed by Raquel Manzano Garcia at Cancer Research UK Cambridge Institute with continuous support from Maxime U Garcia. Based on the RNA-MuTect workflow.
